assessment.title: Financial Readiness (sample from Ch.7, testing here)

items.text: I have 3–6 months of expenses in an emergency fund.
I contribute enough to capture my full employer 401(k) match.
I pay my credit cards in full every month.
I track my cash flow monthly.
I know my target savings rate and hit it most months.
My debt payoff plan is clear and realistic.

los.title: 3.1 — Savings
los.preview: Build your emergency fund and set a target savings rate.

snippets.title: Why savings first
snippets.body: Emergency funds reduce stress and protect your plan. Aim for 3–6 months of expenses in a high-yield savings account.

questions.text: Which account is generally best for an emergency fund?
Roughly how many months of expenses is a common emergency-fund target?
If your savings rate increases from 5% to 10%, what happens (all else equal)?

snippets.title: Habits
snippets.body: Automate savings on payday, then budget what’s left.
